title: Irelia 83% win rate at worlds.
body:

Let's make a hyper-mobile champion with uninterruptible damage reduction and infinite mobility. GJ.

replies.body: For a lengthy tournament like World's it's often best to wait until the end to asses what the overall balance state of the game was. As an example, last week we were being mocked because Kai'sa had a 65% winrate in playins. Now in groups she has a 37% winrate. By the end of the tournament she could totally climb again, but it remains to be seen. Even after this post irelia lost two straight, bringing that 83% winrate down to 63%. When we're dealing with small sample sizes, swings in champ performances can be really drastic after just one day of games, or as the meta in a tournament evolves.

A champion currently doing well doesnt inherently mean you need to make gameplay adjustments. Ideally the playerbase will deal with it themselves, eventually moving towards something that can deal with that specific champion/playstle well and turn the wheel themselves.

Riot tends to buff/nerf to get the wheel turning themselves, given players tend to not like to change things and take risks themselves to make the wheel turn on their own. Placebo buff/nerfs work wonders for this.

But who says EVERYONE is playing her top and jg? I honestly see more Skarner picks than Camille jg picks where I am currently.
